rootCause: A single compromised password for a VPN account that was not protected by multi-factor authentication.
impact: Shutdown of a 5,500-mile pipeline, leading to fuel shortages and price spikes across the U.S. East Coast. A ransom of $4.4 million was paid.
description: The DarkSide ransomware group executed an attack on Colonial Pipeline, the largest fuel pipeline operator in the United States. This attack on critical infrastructure highlighted the severe real-world consequences of cyber threats, causing widespread disruption and panic buying of gasoline.

rootCause: Compromise of SITA, a third-party passenger service system provider used by Air India and other airlines.
impact: Personal data of approximately 4.5 million global passengers, including names, dates of birth, contact information, and passport details, was breached.
description: Air India was affected by a massive data breach originating from its data processor, SITA. The breach exposed a decade's worth of passenger data, highlighting the significant risks associated with third-party vendors in the supply chain.

sources.title: Air India data breach: Personal info of 45 lakh passengers including passport, credit card details leaked

rootCause: The REvil ransomware group exploited a zero-day vulnerability in Kaseya's VSA remote management software.
impact: Ransomware was deployed to the customers of Managed Service Providers (MSPs) using Kaseya VSA, affecting up to 1,500 downstream businesses worldwide.
description: In a major supply chain attack, the REvil ransomware gang compromised Kaseya's VSA software, pushing a malicious update to MSPs. This allowed them to encrypt the systems of hundreds of MSP clients, including schools, retailers, and financial firms, in a single coordinated attack.

sources.title: CISA-FBI Guidance for MSPs and their Customers Affected by the Kaseya VSA Supply-Chain Ransomware Attack

rootCause: Unauthorized use of a dormant remote access software (TeamViewer) with weak security.
impact: An attacker briefly gained control and attempted to increase sodium hydroxide (lye) levels in the water supply to dangerously high levels. The attempt was immediately thwarted.
description: A hacker remotely accessed the computer systems of a water treatment plant in Oldsmar, Florida. They attempted to poison the water supply by drastically increasing the amount of a chemical additive, an incident that highlighted the vulnerability of critical infrastructure control systems.

sources.title: A Hacker Tried to Poison a Florida City's Water Supply, Officials Say
